txt.en: 'Angbor...'
'I was fighting at Linhir against the Corsairs and Southrons, and a wave of dread passed over all that battled.'
'I stood firm, unwilling to abandon the city to the Enemy, but the others... they fled. All of them - my men, the Southrons, and the Corsairs!'
Instance: Sworn to Secrecy
'And then I saw it... the banner of a King and the vast, terrifying force that followed him.'
'There were Men, yes, but the forms of the Dead walked amongst them and fought alongside their captain.'
'When he lifted his helmet, I knew his face at once. Thorongil had returned, and I swore myself to his service at once!'
'Onward we fought into the East, until we reached Pelargir. The Corsairs held it entirely and would not have been moved if not for him!'
'The Dead swept over the entire Corsair force and drove them into the Great River.'
'For that deed, he freed the Dead from their curse and now sails up-river to the White City on the Corsairs' empty ships.'
'The Enemy knows not of his plan, and they must not learn of it until it is too late!'
'I trust that you will not, Terenis.'
'I cannot delay any longer, my Lady. I must return to my men before any more time is lost.'
'Do not thank me yet...'
'Remain here for a time, [placeholder]. The Lady shall have need of you... of this I am certain.'
'Only for my King do I do this...'
'Thank you.'
'I have come bearing a missive for your eyes alone, Lady Terenis.'
'It should put an end to your curiosity and to your foolish threats against [placeholder].'
'And some wonder why I chose the life of a warrior, not a diplomat...'
'Indeed it is, but I would not ignore the command of my captain... and my King.'
'You see, the man you once knew as Thorongil has returned to Gondor, and in his wake there is a force unlike any I have ever imagined.'
'His age is absent in his face, but it is he - Aragorn as he is now known. Only he could have won such a victory at Pelargir.'
'Aragorn has bidden me to tell you of this, that it may ease your mind and give you hope for the fate of the White City...'
'...but you must swear an oath to never speak of these truths, just as [placeholder] and I have.'
'I shall hold you to your word, my Lady, for the fate of Gondor may rest on it. Very well...'
'There is no need for all this posturing, Angbor. If you will tell me what I wish to know, I shall not stand in your way.'
'Come, both of you, join me by the fire...'
'It is interesting that you have gone so far out of your way to visit Tumladen...'
'Thorongil! It cannot be! He was a man in my youth - would not he have grown old after so many years?'
'I knew it. I knew victory had been won! You must tell me of it, Angbor!'
'If Thorongil has bidden it, I shall obey. I swear upon the lives of my sons and my brother that I shall never speak of this again.'
'This... is beyond belief, and yet, I hear truth in your voice.'
'I shall not endanger my brother or Thorongil - I swear it!'
